intro: Dictamnus tadshikorum, commonly known as the Tibetan dictamnus, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its stems are often covered in a distinctive reddish or pinkish resinous coating. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of mountainous regions.
